glsa.title: pmake: Insecure temporary file usage
glsa.synopsis: pmake uses temporary files in an insecure manner, allowing for symlink attacks.

background.p: pmake is Debian’s version of NetBSD’s make, a tool to build programs in parallel.

description.p: /usr/share/mk/bsd.lib.mk and /usr/share/mk/bsd.prog.mk create temporary files insecurely, with predictable names (/tmp/_depend[PID]), and without using $TMPDIR.

impact.p: The make include files allow local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All pmake users should upgrade to the latest version:
